examples: By 1830, most states had abolished the property and religion requirements.
Should we abolish unpaid internships?
Revolutionary Frantz abolished slavery before Britain as the Denmark abolish slave trade.
The new constitution would abolish the prime minister role, seen as a check on presidential power.
As rebellion spread throughout the country, the feudal system was abolished.
words.defineEn: to officially put an end to a law, activity, or system
words.defineVi: để chính thức đặt dấu chấm hết cho một luật, hoạt động, hoặc hệ thống

examples: But if you want to find true fulfillment, it's important to choose a path that aligns with your values and interests.
When their schedules didn't align, the couple made a conscious effort to make time for each other.
Despite the offer of a generous salary, John turned his nose up at the job offer because it didn't align with his career goals.
The locations of the cases aligned almost perfectly with the range of a specific type of tick, the lone star tick.
The Moon’s tidal force aligns with the Sun’s, reinforcing it.
words.defineEn: to agree with a group, idea, person, or organization and support it
words.defineVi: để đồng ý với một nhóm, ý tưởng, người, hoặc tổ chức và hỗ trợ nó

examples: The flow chart shows how resources are allocated.
Judy, the new law allocates $5 billion for farmers of color.
One, they allocate resources.
You allocate uses of funds with sources of funds.
The scoundrel might have allocated the rubies as 8, 14 and 8.
words.defineEn: to give something particular to someone or to use something for a specific purpose
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho một cái gì đó cụ thể cho một ai đó hoặc sử dụng một cái gì đó cho một mục đích cụ thể

examples: She has already made amends by apologizing to him.
Liza mended her fences by making amends with his family.
I wanted to make amends for the worry I've caused you.
The politician tried to save face after a scandal by apologizing and promising to make amends for any wrongdoing.
The employee who made a mistake at work quickly admitted his fault, knowing that a fault confessed is half redressed, and worked hard to make amends for the error.
words.defineEn: to make small changes to a statement, law, etc. to make it more accurate or improve or correct it
words.defineVi: để thực hiện những thay đổi nhỏ đối với một tuyên bố, luật, v.v. để làm cho nó chính xác hơn hoặc cải thiện hoặc sửa chữa nó

examples: Please authorize heart sensor.
Officials have now authorized an overnight curfew through April 12.
Click "Authorize."
The legislation authorizes what is known as extended payments for ambulance services.
Congress could also authorize funding to states for public health emergencies.
words.defineEn: to give someone official permission to do something or to officially permit something
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho một người nào đó sự cho phép chính thức để làm một cái gì đó hoặc chính thức cho phép một cái gì đó

examples: My best friend has been betraying me behind my back.
She was betrayed by a childhood friend who turned government informant.
David couldn't believe that his own flesh and blood would betray him like that.

Being betrayed by a friend made me appreciate the loyalty and trustworthiness of my other friends - misfortunes tell us what fortune is, and I won't overlook the importance of loyalty in my relationships.
When Jane discovered that her friend had betrayed her, she was hurt and vowed not to give her any house room in her life anymore.
words.defineEn: to be disloyal to a person, a group of people, or one's country by giving information about them to their enemy
words.defineVi: không trung thành với một người, một nhóm người hoặc đất nước của một người bằng cách cung cấp thông tin về họ cho kẻ thù của họ

examples: When the teacher fell ill, the substitute had to step into the breach and take over the class.
The company had to eat crow and apologize to its customers after a major data breach exposed their personal information.
After the data breach, the company is going to have to take a long, hard look at their security measures.
The notice must be served upon the tenant and include a legal description of the breach they have committed.
By 1990, CPUs breached the 1 million transistor count.
words.defineEn: to break an agreement, law, etc.
words.defineVi: để phá vỡ một thỏa thuận, pháp luật, vv

examples: Despite the dangers, the siren call of adventure compelled him to explore the uncharted territory.
She felt compelled to bow down in front of the statue, overwhelmed by its beauty.
We are compelled by the law.
What compelled them to represent their ideas in this particular way?
Barney was compelled to check his genitalia.
words.defineEn: to make someone do something
words.defineVi: để làm cho một ai đó làm một cái gì đó

examples: It's a form of self-approval that strokes the ego and compensates for someone's insecurity.
Other countries compensate citizens during lockdowns.
We compensate donors for their time and their commitment to the program.
Compensated fast and generously.
The cost of the immunizations is clearly compensated for by their life-saving value.
words.defineEn: to pay someone for the work they have done
words.defineVi: để trả tiền cho ai đó cho công việc họ đã làm

examples: Drunkenness reveals what soberness conceals, some might say.
He thinks nothing of lying to conceal his incompetence
Despite his efforts to conceal his true nature, his arrogance and selfishness eventually became evident to everyone.
Even though Sarah tried to conceal her feelings, her constant blushing and nervous giggling around John made it obvious.
My hair conceals my elf ears.
words.defineEn: to carefully cover or hide something or someone
words.defineVi: để cẩn thận che hoặc che giấu một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: Energy is conserved.
It is conserved.
It's still conserved overall.
Momentum is conserved.
Momentum is conserved.
words.defineEn: to keep something from change or harm
words.defineVi: để giữ một cái gì đó khỏi thay đổi hoặc làm hại

examples: The philosopher delved into abstract theories of ethics, contemplating the nature of right and wrong.
Seriously contemplating suicide.
Do you ever contemplate going back to the United States illegally?
I do contemplate it, not a lot, because there's a risk.
I have contemplated what it is that I would tell a younger version of myself.
words.defineEn: to think about something particular
words.defineVi: để suy nghĩ về một cái gì đó cụ thể

examples: The company always caters lunch for these meetings, so I don't know why you bring in your own sandwich.
I kind of cater my use around that.
It catered at the games once again.

Competitors like American Express caters to a more affluent customer base with a higher average FICO score and Capital One serves subprime borrowers with an average score below that of Discover's customers.
okay, so the problem is in our culture now, if you have a weird belief, you can find a source that caters to that belief and you don't have to read anything else because the internet.
words.defineEn: to provide a meeting, party, etc. with food and drink
words.defineVi: để cung cấp một cuộc họp, bữa tiệc, vv với thức ăn và đồ uống

examples: Cultivating personal style and inner confidence will be more enduring than just following the latest fads.

The woman had always tried to be friends with everyone, but when she needed support during a difficult time, she realized that all men's friend is no man's friend, and that she needed to focus on cultivating deeper, more authentic connections.
Maybe the real trick to survival is cultivating your sensitive side, for hundreds of millions of years.
Putin cultivated the image of a reformer and a democrat.
Roy cultivated an image as a bulldog.
words.defineEn: to prepare land for raising crops or growing plants
words.defineVi: để chuẩn bị đất để trồng trọt hoặc trồng cây

examples: The central bank has devised a plan to deep clean China's cash.
In Belgium, an engineer devised an adapter for the masks on a 3D printing machine. -
So he devised a diabolical trial.
So he devised an experiment.
But behind the celebration, Trump's nationalists had devised a different plan.
words.defineEn: to design or invent something new or a new method of doing something particular after much thinking
words.defineVi: để thiết kế hoặc phát minh ra một cái gì đó mới hoặc một phương pháp mới để làm một cái gì đó cụ thể sau khi suy nghĩ nhiều

examples: As a vegan, she substituted almond butter for traditional dairy-based spreads.
For a gluten-free option, substitute regular flour with almond flour in the cake recipe.
The baker substituted regular oil with safflower oil in the cake recipe, resulting in a moist and tender texture.
As a vegetarian, I often substitute mozzarella for meat in my sandwiches.
Soymilk works well as a substitute for milk in sauces and creamy pasta dishes.
words.defineEn: to put something different to use
words.defineVi: để đặt một cái gì đó khác nhau để sử dụng

examples: The result of the die roll dictates a step in a different direction.
In both cases the preferred direction is dictated by gravity.
We're going to dictate the terms.
And that, in itself, dictates a tempo.
What do our taste buds and our visual experience dictate?
words.defineEn: to tell someone what to do or not do, in an authoritative way
words.defineVi: để nói với ai đó những gì để làm hoặc không làm, một cách có thẩm quyền

examples: Shatta Wale in an interview has disclosed the first thing Beyoncè told him when she met him, according to him it was like a dream, he never believed his eyes.
The nature of the fees were disclosed.
The company didn't disclose the cost of the new layout to CNBC.
The, the fees were disclosed.
The vast majority of breaches are actually never disclosed.
words.defineEn: to make something known to someone or the public, particularly when it was a secret at first
words.defineVi: để làm cho một cái gì đó được biết đến với ai đó hoặc công chúng, đặc biệt khi nó là một bí mật lúc đầu

examples: During the investigation into the harassment allegations, both the accused employee and the victim were found to have distorted the truth, showcasing how truth is the first casualty of war.

The rise of social media connected people in positive ways but also led to the spread of misinformation, and hate, illustrating that where God builds a church, the devil will build a chapel attempting to undermine and distort good purposes.
Depression can really distort your perception about your future.
You're just distorting the story.
Republican negative campaigning-- divide, distort, and distract-- won't work.
words.defineEn: to change the shape or condition of something in a way that is no longer clear or natural
words.defineVi: để thay đổi hình dạng hoặc điều kiện của một cái gì đó trong một cách không còn rõ ràng hoặc tự nhiên

examples: Sarah believes that people are inherently good, and that if you approach them with kindness and trust, they will reciprocate - she truly embodies the idea that to the pure all things are pure.
Back in the day, Forever 21 embodied the American dream.
The bags embody absolute luxury.
- Embody the spirit of the gamer.
The threat of cannibalism is embodied by the Windigo.
words.defineEn: to represent a quality or belief
words.defineVi: để đại diện cho một chất lượng hoặc niềm tin

examples: The retirement community organized a workshop to teach seniors how to become silver surfers, empowering them to navigate the internet, shop online, and access information at their fingertips.
Thus a generation was empowered through interactive media.
I was empowered by my mother
We can empower ourselves.
And that's really empowering if you think about it.
words.defineEn: to give someone the power or authorization to do something particular
words.defineVi: để cung cấp cho ai đó sức mạnh hoặc ủy quyền để làm một cái gì đó cụ thể

examples: Ach partner is entitled to share in the profits of the business.
People are entitled to their privacy.
I'm not entitled to anything.
And all countries are entitled to have a border.
Everybody is entitled to their own opinion, but not to their own facts.
words.defineEn: (often passive) to give someone the legal right to have or do something particular
words.defineVi: (thường bị động) trao cho ai đó quyền hợp pháp để có hoặc làm điều gì đó cụ thể

examples: They carefully extracted the stone from the nectarine, savoring the velvety flesh around it.
A touch of maple extract in the pancake batter gives them a delightful maple syrup taste.
He crushed the dried capsules of the poppy flowers to extract the tiny seeds for culinary purposes.
I love adding a dash of almond extract to my morning oatmeal.
I'm thinking of adding some meat extract to the marinade for the grilled chicken.
words.defineEn: to take something out from something else, particularly when it is not easy to do
words.defineVi: lấy cái gì ra khỏi cái gì khác, đặc biệt khi nó không dễ làm

examples: We have included some hints for beginners in this section.
They added a pinch of maple sugar to their morning coffee for a hint of natural sweetness.
Almond-leaved pear has a mild sweetness and a hint of almond taste.
I tried a new coffee blend with hints of chocolate and caramel.
The carob-covered almonds provided a delightful crunch and a hint of sweetness in every bite.
words.defineEn: to indirectly suggest something
words.defineVi: để gián tiếp đề nghị một cái gì đó

examples: The students were instructed to collect leaves for their biology project.
The chef instructed us to finely chop the mirepoix vegetables before adding them to the sauce.
The employee received their marching orders from the supervisor and was instructed to start a new project.

The editor-in-chief instructed her reporters to uphold journalistic ethics and avoid using language that could be seen as defamatory or discriminatory, reminding them of the proverb a goose quill is more dangerous than a lion's claw.

The contractor instructed his crew to complete the construction project before inviting the clients for a walkthrough, as he didn't want them to see the unfinished work - after all, fools and bairns should never see half done work.
words.defineEn: to tell someone to do something, particularly in an official manner
words.defineVi: để bảo ai đó làm điều gì đó, đặc biệt là theo cách chính thức

examples: He lingered indecisively outside the train station.
I want to lay to rest any lingering doubts about my decision.
So the pain lingers.
But the pain lingers.
But the thought still lingers.
words.defineEn: to stay somewhere longer because one does not want to leave
words.defineVi: ở lại một nơi nào đó lâu hơn bởi vì một người không muốn rời đi

examples: The frozen berries included a color retention agent that prevented the vibrant red color from fading during storage.
He wore an old pair of jeans that were worn and faded.
Suggesting that she may be focusing so much on small imperfections because her feelings for him have faded.
The controversial artwork caused a stir in the art world, but it turned out to be just a nine day wonder, quickly fading from public attention as other artistic creations gained prominence.
Despite their faded friendship, Emily and Alex remained on nodding terms, acknowledging each other with a friendly nod whenever they crossed paths.
words.defineEn: to disappear slowly
words.defineVi: biến mất từ từ

examples: They couldn't predict the disastrous war looming a few years down the road.
She was a critic who loomed large in literary circles.
Fear of failure loomed large in his mind.
The issue of pay will loom large at this year's conference.
Rising tuition costs loom large in the minds of many parents.
words.defineEn: to appear as a large shape that is unclear, particularly in a manner that is threatening
words.defineVi: xuất hiện dưới dạng một hình dạng lớn không rõ ràng, đặc biệt là theo cách đe dọa

examples: There has been public outrage after it came to light that some people had been jumping the queue for surgery appointments because they had a friend or relative working at the hospital.
President Trump's comments sparked national outrage.
This sparked national outrage.
Outrage exploded again in 1992 with the release of games like Mortal Kombat and Night Trap.
The reaction from the other side was immediate: more outrage.
words.defineEn: to cause someone to become extremely angry or shocked
words.defineVi: để gây ra một ai đó để trở nên cực kỳ tức giận hoặc bị sốc

examples: The firm has moved to reassure customers that they will continue to provide good service.
Sarah was nervous about hosting her first dinner party, but her mom reassured her that the food was secondary because as they say it's the company that makes the feast.
Ruth did her best to reassure her.
The old farmer reassured his grandson, "Don't be afraid of the snake, it's dead and dead men don't bite."
After the accident, I was in a lot of pain, but the doctor reassured me that time works wonders and that I would heal.
words.defineEn: to do or say something to make someone stop worrying or less afraid
words.defineVi: làm hoặc nói điều gì đó để khiến ai đó ngừng lo lắng hoặc bớt sợ hãi

examples: I simply can't tolerate her selfish behavior any longer.
By taking this action, we are sending a message that bullying will not be tolerated.
The entrepreneur who quit after facing a few minor setbacks will never build a successful business, proving that a man who cannot tolerate small misfortunes, can never accomplish great things.
I can't believe that I have to tolerate her for the entire term!
Dissent is not tolerated.
words.defineEn: to not oppose or prohibit something one does not like or agree with
words.defineVi: không phản đối hoặc cấm điều gì đó mà người ta không thích hoặc đồng ý với

examples: The company overlooked a small detail in their contract, and now they're facing a costly lawsuit.
He overlooked her flaws and became blind to any shortcomings.
They celebrated their anniversary at a fancy restaurant overlooking the city.
The young executive knew that a fool shows his annoyance at once, but a prudent man overlooks an insult, so he decided to take a deep breath and respond to the feedback in a constructive way.

Being betrayed by a friend made me appreciate the loyalty and trustworthiness of my other friends - misfortunes tell us what fortune is, and I won't overlook the importance of loyalty in my relationships.
words.defineEn: to not notice or see something
words.defineVi: để không thông báo hoặc nhìn thấy một cái gì đó

examples: Even if one is confident in his innocence, it is not appropriate to be a judge in his own cause, as it undermines the credibility of the decision-making process.

The rise of social media connected people in positive ways but also led to the spread of misinformation, and hate, illustrating that where God builds a church, the devil will build a chapel attempting to undermine and distort good purposes.
No major disasters in the financial markets to undermine trust in the system.
In 2005 several events undermined the public’s confidence in the Bush administration.
That attitude could undermine popular support for the movement.
words.defineEn: to gradually decrease the effectiveness, confidence, or power of something or someone
words.defineVi: để giảm dần hiệu quả, sự tự tin, hoặc sức mạnh của một cái gì đó hoặc ai đó

examples: The couple knelt before the altar to exchange their vows.
When Jane discovered that her friend had betrayed her, she was hurt and vowed not to give her any house room in her life anymore.
Emma and Michael had been in a committed relationship for a long time, so they finally took the plunge and exchanged wedding vows.
The protesters were determined to make their voices heard and vowed not to yield until their demands were met.
He vowed that he would keep fighting until the bitter end.
words.defineEn: to make a solemn promise to do or not do something particular
words.defineVi: để thực hiện một lời hứa long trọng để làm hoặc không làm điều gì đó cụ thể

examples: The political landscape has turned full circle, with the same issues resurfacing after decades of apparent progress.
And he just resurfaces to continue to assert that he does not accept the results of the election, that he's challenging those results.
One year later, after reforms went into effect, the pension crisis resurfaced as an issue in the gubernatorial race, this time for state teachers and school workers.
So saying that friction comes and resurfaces isn't wrong, but it's not the whole story.
In fact, I've seen it resurfacing to this day.
words.defineEn: to once again become noticeable, significant, or problematic
words.defineVi: để một lần nữa trở nên đáng chú ý, quan trọng, hoặc có vấn đề

examples: Emily achieved great success in her career at the ripe old age of 25, leaving everyone astonished.
We were astonished.
In the ninth century, visitors from beyond the frontier were astonished at the graceful stone arches and domes of the imperial palace in Constantinople.
And they were astonished to find species without really important genes.
Tim Wright, a geologist at the University of Leeds who interpreted the satellite results, was astonished by the images and what they pointed to.
words.defineEn: to impress or surprise someone very much
words.defineVi: để gây ấn tượng hoặc ngạc nhiên một ai đó rất nhiều

examples: The author was criticized for rehashing old ideas in their latest book.
We don't need to rehash that old argument again.
Larry David-- That same old title rehashed again.
He loves nothing more than rehashing these breadcrumb trails for the dopey constables at the end of the case.
And so, it's important for us to be patient and understanding with their process versus maybe yelling at them like, "Hey, stop rehashing the past!"
words.defineEn: to present something old or already used in a slightly different way or with minor alterations, often without adding anything new.
words.defineVi: để trình bày một cái gì đó cũ hoặc đã được sử dụng theo một cách hơi khác hoặc với những thay đổi nhỏ, thường không thêm bất cứ điều gì mới.

examples: If I find out that Paul was the one who sabotaged my presentation to the board, I'll have his head on a plate!
Despite our efforts, he did his thing and sabotaged all our plans.
The coworker who intentionally sabotages a colleague's project may find themselves facing similar setbacks in their own work, showing how he who digs a pit for others, falls in himself.
I can't believe that you're the one who did me dirty and sabotaged my presentation!
Google traced the sabotage back to China.
words.defineEn: to intentionally damage, destroy, or undermine something, especially for personal gain or as an act of protest or revenge
words.defineVi: cố ý làm hỏng, phá hủy hoặc làm suy yếu một cái gì đó, đặc biệt là vì lợi ích cá nhân hoặc như một hành động phản đối hoặc trả thù
